properties.Title: Advisory Alert Update - Civil Emergency
properties.Summary:
Description: This emergency advisory alert is being issued for the province of Saskatchewan. All travelers returning from outside of Canada are subject to a mandatory 14 day self isolation order. Violation of the order may result in a fine of 2000 dollars.
Expires: 2020-12-23T23:45:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-12-09T15:55:47-06:00, 01533C4C-8070-1C4D-842D-E3F4C532B67E
Area: Province of Saskatchewan
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong southerly winds will lift the snow and produce blizzard conditions over this community this evening until early Thursday morning. Protect yourself from the wind, the cold and disorientation by staying safely inside. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-10T12:16:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-09T20:17:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1284649509.2020
Area: Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow today with a risk of freezing rain this morning. A fast moving weather system will bring an area of snow to northwestern Ontario beginning early this morning and tapering off this afternoon. Snowfall amounts around 5 cm are possible. There will also be a threat of freezing rain this morning. Motorists and pedestrians are advised to exercise caution as roadways and surfaces may become icy and slippery. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-10T21:58:45-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-10T05:59:45-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0841834980.2020
Area: Kenora - Grassy Narrows - Whitedog, Sioux Narrows - Nestor Falls - Morson, Dryden - Vermilion Bay, Ignace - English River, Fort Frances - Emo - Rainy River, Seine River Village - Mine Centre, City of Thunder Bay, Upsala - Raith, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park, Cloud Bay - Dorion, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake, Nipigon - Rossport
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A slow moving low pressure system over northwestern Hudson Bay combined with a building Arctic ridge of high pressure over western Nunavut will produce strong winds over the Kivalliq and Melville Peninsula over the next several days. By Thursday afternoon, temperatures falling into the minus twenties combined with wind gusts up to 80 km/h will create ideal conditions for heavy blowing snow. Blizzard or near blizzard conditions are likely with significantly reduced visibilities. Over the Kivalliq, conditions will deteriorate Thursday morning with improvement forecast by Friday morning. Over the Melville Peninsula, conditions will begin to deteriorate Thursday afternoon and improve Friday overnight. Please stay alert for updated bulletins as this winter storm watch may be upgraded to a blizzard warning for some communities as the event nears. And please refer to your local forecast for additional information on wind speeds and timing. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Winter storm watches are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-10T12:15:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-09T20:16:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0494347725.2020
Area: Sanirajak, Igloolik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Southerly wind gusting to near 90 km/h will persist until late in the day over this community. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-10T08:10:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-09T16:11:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0375565861.2020
Area: Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A shift from the mild, above seasonal weather is coming to southern Manitoba. A fast moving low pressure system tracking across the northern United States will spread mixed precipitation to southern Manitoba tonight, beginning first over western areas this evening and tracking eastwards through the night. This low pressure system will bring a mix of rain, snow and freezing rain. A narrow band of around 5 cm of snowfall accumulation will stretch from roughly Brandon to Winnipeg to the Ontario border, with possible pockets of higher snowfall accumulations embedded in the main band. There is also a significant risk for freezing rain, over western Manitoba, the Red River Valley and points eastwards during the late evening and overnight hours. Freezing rain warnings may be required as the event nears and conditions are monitored. This low pressure system will usher in a cooler, more seasonal weather pattern. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-10T13:27:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-09T21:28:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3268241237.2020

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Northerly winds gusting up to 80 km/h combined with falling snow will produce blizzard conditions in Naujaat beginning Thursday morning and persisting through the day before gradually improving overnight on Thursday. Along with the blizzard conditions, Naujaat will also see a significant drop in temperatures. Temperatures will fall to the mid minus twenties through the day on Thursday. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-10T12:18:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-09T20:19:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0620212919.2020
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Dense fog with near zero visibility has developed over Similkameen, Nicola and the 100 Mile area this evening. The fog is expected to continue through Thursday morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-10T17:24:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-10T01:25:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3365513131.2020
Area: Highway 3 - Hope to Princeton via Allison Pass, Highway 97 - Clinton to 100 Mile House via Begbie Summit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow with a risk of freezing rain tonight into Thursday morning. A fast moving weather system will bring an area of snow to northwestern Ontario beginning near midnight and tapering off later Thursday morning. Snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm are possible. There will also be a threat of freezing rain. Motorists and pedestrians are advised to exercise caution as roadways and surfaces may become icy and slippery. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A sloppy Friday morning commute is expected. Total snowfall: 5 to 10 cm, with potentially greater amounts along the eastern shore. Locations: Avalon peninsula. Time span: early Friday morning until early Friday evening. Maximum wind gusts: northeasterly 60 km/h. Remarks: A low pressure system is expected to pass southeast of the island on Friday, bringing a period of snow, potentially mixing with rain along parts of the coast. Temperatures are forecast to remain slightly above the freezing mark throughout the event. As a result, driving conditions are expected to be hazardous, especially during the morning commute, as the settling snow will become slushy on the roads and walkways. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-12-10T19:51:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-10T03:52:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3525403265.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity, Avalon Peninsula Southwest
